election_record.label: New York 1811 Lieutenant Governor, Special

overview.note: Election to replace John Broome, deceased.

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nicholas Tish.
Marinus Willett received 1 vote as Morinus Willell.
The Official Canvass for Lieutenant Governor lists 8 votes for Marinus Willett as Morinus Willel. The Town Election Returns, however, report "Morenis Willell had one vote for Lieutenant Governor."
The Official Canvass for Lieutenant Governor lists DeWitt Clinton with 840 votes in the county and 173 votes in the city of Albany, but the Town Election Returns show him with 183 votes.

sub_unit.name: Colonie
sub_unit.note: Marinus Willett received 1 vote as Morinus Willell.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaerville
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 216 votes.

sub_unit.name: Watervliet
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists Marinus Willett with 2 votes.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 30, the Farmers' Register (Troy, NY) of May 28 and the Republican (Plattsburgh, NY) of May 10 list DeWitt Clinton with 389 votes and Nicholas Fish with 155 votes, but those numbers are without any votes yet from the town of Lewis.

sub_unit.name: Hebron
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) and the Northern Budget (Troy, NY) list Marinus Willett with one vote in Hebron.

sub_unit.name: Johnsburg
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) and the Northern Budget (Troy, NY) list Marinus Willett with zero votes in Johnsburg.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as Clinton.
Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as holas Fish.

sub_unit.name: Canaan
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as Clinton.
Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as holas Fish.

sub_unit.name: Chatham
sub_unit.note: The Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) lists DeWitt Clinton with 124 votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nicholas Fisher.

sub_unit.name: Harpersfield
sub_unit.note: Plebeian (Kingston, NY) of May 14 lists Marinus Willett with 38 votes in Harpersfield, however it lists the total votes for him in Delaware County as 52, which is the sum if the total in Harpersfield is 31 (as is listed in The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 28).

sub_unit.name: Stamford
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 28 lists Nicholas Fish with 65 votes in Stamford, however it lists the total votes for him in Delaware County as 436, which is the sum if the total for him in Stamford is 66 (as is listed in the Plebeian (Kingston, NY) of May 14).

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as DeWitt Governor.

sub_unit.name: Rockland
sub_unit.note: The two sources for Rockland County, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 9 and the New York Journal of May 8, give reversed results for Marinus Willett in Clarkstown and Hempstead. The New York Journal lists Willett with 50 votes in Clarkstown and 54 votes in Hempstead, and does not list results in Haverstraw for any of the candidates.

sub_unit.name: Sullivan
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) of May 17 lists only joint totals for two candidates, for Sullivan and Ulster Counties combined. DeWitt Clinton is listed with 1021 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 1082 total votes for the two counties, which match the sums of the votes listed separately by county in other sources.

The Columbian (New York, NY) lists only totals for Sullivan and Ulster counties combined in its May 14 edition, reporting Nicholas Fish with 1081 total votes. However, in its later edition of May 21, which includes town totals, The Columbian (New York, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 1082 totals votes (which is the sum of the town totals it lists).
Plebeian (Kingston, NY) lists total votes in Sullivan and Ulster Counties for Marinus Willett as 164, however, the sum for the towns as listed in the 2 counties is 163.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) of May 17 lists only joint totals for two candidates, for Sullivan and Ulster Counties combined. DeWitt Clinton is listed with 1021 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 1082 total votes for the two counties, which match the sums of the votes listed separately by county (and town) in other sources.
Plebeian (Kingston, NY) lists total votes in Sullivan and Ulster Counties for Marinus Willett as 164, however, the sum for the towns as listed in the 2 counties is 163.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: Two different sets of newspaper results were printed. The incorrect totals listed as "Official Returns" which list Nicholas Fish with 2039 votes are the New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), New-York Herald (New York, NY), The New York Journal, Norfolk Gazette and Publick Ledger (Norfolk, VA), The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and the United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA).

Two different sets of newspaper results were printed. The incorrect totals listed as "Official Returns" which list Marinus Willett with 689 votes are the New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), New-York Herald (New York, NY), The New York Journal, The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and the United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA).
The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 3, 1811 listed results with several anomalies and inaccuracies when compared to the other 2 sets of newspaper results, which therefore, are not recorded here.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: Two different sets of newspaper results were printed. The incorrect totals listed as "Official Returns" which list Marinus Willett with 62 votes are the Commercial Advertiser (New York, NY) of May 3, New-York Evening Post (New York, NY) and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), The New York Journal, The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and the United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA).

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: Two different sets of newspaper results were printed. The incorrect totals listed as "Official Returns" which list Nicholas Fish with 201 votes are the Commercial Advertiser (New York, NY) of May 3, New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), New-York Herald (New York, NY), The New York Journal, The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) and the United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA).

sub_unit.name: Queens
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nichols Fish.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) of May 9 lists DeWitt Clinton with 266 votes, Nicholas Fish with 323 votes and Marinus Willett with 569 votes in Suffolk County.

The Columbian (New York, NY), the New York Journal and the Public Advertiser (New York, NY) all printed early returns prior to May 8 with incorrect totals listing DeWitt Clinton with 511 total votes, Nicholas Fish with 335 total votes and Marinus Willett with 678 total votes. Each of these newspapers subsequently printed corrected total votes on May 16 or May 18 for each of the candidates.

sub_unit.name: Shelter Island
sub_unit.note: Early editions of The Columbian (New York, NY), on May 6, the New York Journal on May 8 and the Public Advertiser (New York, NY) on May 7 list Nicholas Fish with 0 votes and Marinus Willet with 23 votes.

sub_unit.name: Smithtown
sub_unit.note: Early editions of The Columbian (New York, NY), on May 6, the New York Journal on May 8 and the Public Advertiser (New York, NY) on May 7 list DeWitt Clinton with 31 votes.

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: Marinus Willett received 1 vote as Marnus Willett.

The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 15 lists the "CANVASS of WESTCHESTER COUNTY (Authentic) for Lieut. Governor" as follows: DeWitt Clinton with 643 total votes, Nicholas Fish with 902 total votes, and Marinus Willett with 174 total votes.

sub_unit.name: Peekskill
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) of May 9 is the source for the vote counts in Peekskill.

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: "You will perceive that the whole number of votes taken in our county is not equal to the whole number of republican votes which were taken last year. This apathy arose from a belief that there was no danger of Mr. Clinton losing his election." The Columbian (New York, NY). May 16, 1811.

sub_unit.name: Cortland
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nickitos Filch.

The 3 votes for Nicholas Fish in Solon were not included in the Official Canvass which listed him with 177 votes for Cortland County, instead of the 180 votes listed for Fish in The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 24.

sub_unit.name: Cincinnatus
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nickitos Filch.

sub_unit.name: Solon
sub_unit.note: The votes for Nicholas Fish in Solon were not included in the Official Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as DeWitt Governor.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 681 votes though the town totals add up to 689.
The Original Election Books list Nicholas Fish with 686 votes.

sub_unit.name: Houndsfield
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 45 votes.
The Original Election Books list Nicholas Fish with 45 votes.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Marinus Willett is reported in the Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) as receiving 15 votes in the county, but there is no listing of the votes for him by town.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as DeWitt Clinto.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 33 votes as Nichols Fish.

sub_unit.name: Saint Lawrence
sub_unit.note: DeWitt Clinton received 1 vote as DeWitt Clinto and 1 vote as DeWitt Cinton.

sub_unit.name: Troupsburg
sub_unit.note: There were no votes for Lieutenant Governor reported in Troupsburg.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
